fast3d

Class Panel3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • fast3d.Panel3d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiThreadPanel3d

    public class Panel3d
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    a swing component to display a 3d-scene, containing a universe
    subclasses are permitted the possibility to override the render()-method to draw directly into the 3d-scenery or to override the preRender()-method to prepare all data to be draw (for instance apply camera-movement or transformations of the scenery)
    applies the screens aspect ratio automatically to the camera

    HUDs- Head-up-Displays and 2d GUI components:

    Author:
    Tim Trense
    See Also:
    • you can add static HUDs as a renderable to the universe
    • you can add interactive HUDs as AWT/swing components to the Panel3d
    both types are rendered on top (over) the 3d-scenery and will not effect user-controls which react only on events just on the Panel3d but not on the GUI-components or the renderable-HUDs    , Serialized Form

      for a given coordinate on the Panel3d the 3d point in the universe is returned that is on the screen at the transformed given screen position
      Control getControl() 
      Universe getUniverse() 
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g) 
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> pick(int x, int y)
      used to pick all Renderables by click on the panel
      may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
      works like a 3d-click
      Renderable pickClosest(int x, int y)
      used to pick the closest-to-the-camera Renderable of all Renderables in the Universe by click on the panel
      may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
      void preRender()
      called before every drawing activity or initializing the graphics3d-context
      called in paintComponent()
      every camera movement or changes on the scene should be done here
      subclasses are requested to call super, because of some automatically stuff the super class may do
      if a control is set, subclasses should call super.preRender() to not break the control-input-performance
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called on every paintComponent-call
      draws the universe
      subclasses are requested to call super, because of the automatically render of the universe
      void repaint() 
      void setControl(Control c)
      sets the given control to the default one for this
      the controls performInput() method is called on preRender()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Panel3d

        public Panel3d(Universe uni)
        default settings:
        • background black
        • foreground white
        • double buffered disabled
        • focusable
        Parameters:
        uni - the universe containing all the data to display

    • Method Detail

      • getUniverse

        public Universe getUniverse()
        Returns:
        the universe containing all the 3d-objects

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • repaint

        public void repaint()
        Overrides:
        repaint in class java.awt.Component

      • asyncPreRender

        public void asyncPreRender()
        called on repaint() to perform changes on the Universe that are not synchronous to the render-process

      • preRender

        public void preRender()
        called before every drawing activity or initializing the graphics3d-context
        called in paintComponent()
        every camera movement or changes on the scene should be done here
        subclasses are requested to call super, because of some automatically stuff the super class may do
        if a control is set, subclasses should call super.preRender() to not break the control-input-performance

      • render

        public void render(Graphics3d g)
        called on every paintComponent-call
        draws the universe
        subclasses are requested to call super, because of the automatically render of the universe
        Parameters:
        g - the 3d-graphics context

      • pick

        public java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> pick(int x,
                                                     int y)
        used to pick all Renderables by click on the panel
        may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
        works like a 3d-click
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the click
        y - the y-coordinate of the click
        Returns:
        all Renderables which were detected

      • get3dScreenPoint

        public Vector3d get3dScreenPoint(int x,
                                 int y)
        for a given coordinate on the Panel3d the 3d point in the universe is returned that is on the screen at the transformed given screen position
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of this Panel3d
        y - the y-coordinate of this Panel3d
        Returns:
        the corresponding point on the screen of the camera in the scenery

      • pickClosest

        public Renderable pickClosest(int x,
                              int y)
        used to pick the closest-to-the-camera Renderable of all Renderables in the Universe by click on the panel
        may return null if rayTracing is not supported by the universe or no Renderable was detected
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the click
        y - the y-coordinate of the click
        Returns:
        probably the Renderable the user was expecting to click on

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the backing universes are equal

      • setControl

        public void setControl(Control c)
        sets the given control to the default one for this
        the controls performInput() method is called on preRender()
        Parameters:
        c - the new default control
        See Also:
        preRender()

      • getControl

        public Control getControl()
        Returns:
        the default control thats performInput() method is called on every preRender() call
